description: Automatically checks for outdated dependencies and suggests updates with security analysis
author: JSONbored
features: Automated dependency analysis for multiple package managers
Breaking change warnings for major version updates

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Read the tool input from stdin
INPUT=$(cat)
TOOL_NAME=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_name')
FILE_PATH=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // .tool_input.path // ""')

if [ -z "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
  exit 0
fi

# Check if it's a dependency file
if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *package.json ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *requirements.txt ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *Gemfile ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *go.mod ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *Cargo.toml ]]; then
  echo "ðŸ“¦ Dependency file detected: $FILE_PATH" >&2
  
  # Node.js projects
  if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *package.json ]]; then
    echo "ðŸŸ¢ Node.js project detected - checking dependencies..." >&2
    
    if command -v npm &> /dev/null; then
      echo "ðŸ” Running npm outdated check..." >&2
      OUTDATED_OUTPUT=$(npm outdated --depth=0 2>/dev/null || echo "No outdated packages")
      
      if [ "$OUTDATED_OUTPUT" = "No outdated packages" ]; then
        echo "âœ… All npm packages are up to date" >&2
      else
        echo "ðŸ“Š Found outdated npm packages:" >&2
        echo "$OUTDATED_OUTPUT" | head -10 >&2
        
        OUTDATED_COUNT=$(echo "$OUTDATED_OUTPUT" | wc -l)
        echo "ðŸ“ˆ Total outdated packages: $OUTDATED_COUNT" >&2
      fi
      
      # Check for security vulnerabilities
      echo "ðŸ”’ Checking for security vulnerabilities..." >&2
      AUDIT_OUTPUT=$(npm audit --audit-level=moderate 2>&1)
      
      if echo "$AUDIT_OUTPUT" | grep -q "found 0 vulnerabilities"; then
        echo "âœ… No security vulnerabilities found" >&2
      else
        VULN_COUNT=$(echo "$AUDIT_OUTPUT" | grep -o '[0-9]\+ vulnerabilities' | head -1 || echo "unknown vulnerabilities")
        echo "âš ï¸ Security audit found: $VULN_COUNT" >&2
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Run 'npm audit fix' to automatically fix vulnerabilities" >&2
      fi
      
      # Check for npm-check-updates availability
      if command -v npx &> /dev/null && npx ncu --version &> /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "ðŸ”§ Running npm-check-updates for detailed analysis..." >&2
        NCU_OUTPUT=$(npx ncu 2>/dev/null | head -5)
        echo "$NCU_OUTPUT" >&2
      else
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Install npm-check-updates for better dependency analysis: npm install -g npm-check-updates" >&2
      fi
    else
      echo "âš ï¸ npm command not available" >&2
    fi
    
  # Python projects
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *requirements.txt ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *pyproject.toml ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ Python project detected - checking dependencies..." >&2
    
    if command -v pip &> /dev/null; then
      echo "ðŸ” Checking for outdated Python packages..." >&2
      PIP_OUTDATED=$(pip list --outdated 2>/dev/null || echo "Unable to check outdated packages")
      
      if [ "$PIP_OUTDATED" = "Unable to check outdated packages" ]; then
        echo "âš ï¸ Unable to check pip packages" >&2
      else
        OUTDATED_COUNT=$(echo "$PIP_OUTDATED" | wc -l)
        if [ "$OUTDATED_COUNT" -gt 1 ]; then
          echo "ðŸ“Š Found $OUTDATED_COUNT outdated Python packages" >&2
          echo "$PIP_OUTDATED" | head -5 >&2
        else
          echo "âœ… All Python packages are up to date" >&2
        fi
      fi
      
      # Check for security issues with safety
      if command -v safety &> /dev/null; then
        echo "ðŸ”’ Running Safety security check..." >&2
        SAFETY_OUTPUT=$(safety check --json 2>/dev/null || safety check 2>/dev/null || echo "Safety check completed")
        
        if echo "$SAFETY_OUTPUT" | grep -q "No known security vulnerabilities"; then
          echo "âœ… No known security vulnerabilities in Python dependencies" >&2
        else
          echo "âš ï¸ Safety scan found potential security issues" >&2
        fi
      else
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Install Safety for Python security scanning: pip install safety" >&2
      fi
    else
      echo "âš ï¸ pip command not available" >&2
    fi
    
  # Ruby projects
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *Gemfile ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ’Ž Ruby project detected - checking dependencies..." >&2
    
    if command -v bundle &> /dev/null; then
      echo "ðŸ” Checking for outdated Ruby gems..." >&2
      BUNDLE_OUTDATED=$(bundle outdated 2>/dev/null | head -10 || echo "Unable to check outdated gems")
      echo "$BUNDLE_OUTDATED" >&2
      
      # Check for security issues
      if bundle exec bundler-audit --version &> /dev/null; then
        echo "ðŸ”’ Running bundler-audit security check..." >&2
        BUNDLE_AUDIT=$(bundle exec bundler-audit check 2>&1 || echo "Bundle audit completed")
        
        if echo "$BUNDLE_AUDIT" | grep -q "No vulnerabilities found"; then
          echo "âœ… No vulnerabilities found in Ruby gems" >&2
        else
          echo "âš ï¸ Bundle audit found potential issues" >&2
        fi
      else
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Install bundler-audit: gem install bundler-audit" >&2
      fi
    else
      echo "âš ï¸ bundle command not available" >&2
    fi
    
  # Go projects
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *go.mod ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ¹ Go project detected - checking dependencies..." >&2
    
    if command -v go &> /dev/null; then
      echo "ðŸ” Checking Go module dependencies..." >&2
      
      # List modules
      GO_LIST=$(go list -m -u all 2>/dev/null | head -10 || echo "Unable to list Go modules")
      echo "$GO_LIST" >&2
      
      # Check for available updates
      OUTDATED_MODULES=$(echo "$GO_LIST" | grep -c '\[' 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      if [ "$OUTDATED_MODULES" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "ðŸ“Š Found $OUTDATED_MODULES Go modules with available updates" >&2
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Run 'go get -u ./...' to update dependencies" >&2
      else
        echo "âœ… All Go modules are up to date" >&2
      fi
    else
      echo "âš ï¸ go command not available" >&2
    fi
    
  # Rust projects
  elif [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *Cargo.toml ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ¦€ Rust project detected - checking dependencies..." >&2
    
    if command -v cargo &> /dev/null; then
      # Check for outdated crates
      if cargo outdated --version &> /dev/null; then
        echo "ðŸ” Checking for outdated Rust crates..." >&2
        CARGO_OUTDATED=$(cargo outdated 2>/dev/null | head -10 || echo "Unable to check outdated crates")
        echo "$CARGO_OUTDATED" >&2
      else
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Install cargo-outdated: cargo install cargo-outdated" >&2
      fi
      
      # Security audit
      if cargo audit --version &> /dev/null; then
        echo "ðŸ”’ Running Rust security audit..." >&2
        CARGO_AUDIT=$(cargo audit 2>&1 || echo "Audit completed")
        
        if echo "$CARGO_AUDIT" | grep -q "Success No vulnerable packages found"; then
          echo "âœ… No vulnerable crates found" >&2
        else
          echo "âš ï¸ Cargo audit found potential issues" >&2
        fi
      else
        echo "ðŸ’¡ Install cargo-audit: cargo install cargo-audit" >&2
      fi
    else
      echo "âš ï¸ cargo command not available" >&2
    fi
  fi
  
  # General recommendations
  echo "" >&2
  echo "ðŸ“‹ Dependency Update Best Practices:" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Review changelogs before major version updates" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Test thoroughly after dependency updates" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Update security-critical packages immediately" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Use lockfiles for reproducible builds" >&2
  
else
  echo "File $FILE_PATH is not a recognized dependency file, skipping analysis" >&2
fi

exit 0

useCases: Automated dependency health monitoring during development
Security vulnerability detection in package updates
CI/CD pipeline integration for dependency validation
